result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:41 PM  Defendant Erik Jacob Christensen in Court.  Attorney Liesl E. Nelson in court for Erik Jacob Christensen.  Assistant District Attorney Joseph M. Schieffer in Court for State of Wisconsin.  Court advises Defendant of charges and possible penalties.  Further reading waived.  NG pleas entered.  Bond remains.  Court questions Defendant's address and phone.

1:37 PM Defendant Erik Jacob Christensen in Court.  Attorney Liesl E. Nelson in court for Erik Jacob Christensen.  Assistant District Attorney Joseph M. Schieffer in Court for State of Wisconsin.  22CF105 set for Preliminary Hearing.  20CT56, 20CT58, 20CT59, 22CM40, 22CM44, 22CM47 set for Status.  Court questions Defendant and advises him of rights.  Court finds Defendant freely, intelligently and knowingly waives constitutional right to a Preliminary Hearing.  Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for further proceedings.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on September 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
NO VIOLENT OR ABUSIVE CONTACT WITH R.A.B.

3:31 PM Prosecuting attorney Kaley Walker in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Erik Jacob Christensen appeared in custody via Zoom videoconferencing from PCJ.  Attorney Kaitlyn Dippolito appears via Zoom videoconferencing w/supervision of Atty. Travis Satorius. Includes Initial on 22CF105, Return on Warrant on 22CM40, 22CM44, 22CM47, 22CT56, 20CT59, 20CT59.  Court questions nonappearance.  Defendant states he did not have transportation or phone.  State does not object to quashing warrants and reinstating bonds.  Court quashes warrants and reinstates bonds in 22CM40, 22CM44, 22CM47, 22CT56, 20CT59, 20CT59.  Court addresses Initial Appearance on 22CF105.  Court advises of charges and possible penalties.  Further reading waived.  Court advises of constitutional rights.  State requests $500 cash bond with no contact with R.A.B. or residence.  ADA Walker states basis for cash bond request.  Atty. Dippolito requests signature bond as Defendant is eligible for PD.  Court orders $10,000 signature bond w/conditions as requested.  Court cautions defendant that further missed appearances will result in a cash bond  Court questions Defendant's address, dob, phone.  Defendant states he still lives with RAB.  State willing to amend to no violent or abusive contact.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
DE in custody - E: DA & Email: Jail & Dispatch. eif

01:56 PM Defendant Erik Jacob Christensen not in court.  Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Nelson appeared in court. 20CT56, 20CT58, 20CT59, 22CM40, and 22CM44 set for status. 22CF105 set for initial appearance. ADA Schieffer requests a warrant on each case. Nelson: no information on Defendant. Court orders statewide warrants on 20CT56, 20CT58, 20CT59, 22CM40, and 22CM44  and adjoining states on 22cf105.
